note.p: Birth: Hall Place, Kent, England (14/16 September 1800)
Baptism: London Borough of Bexley (12 October 1800)

Career: Entered HEIC Service (1822-1835); Staff Surgeon, Calcutta and Cawnpore, India (before 1840); retired (by 1840); inventor of the respirator (1835); invented improvements to sun blinds (1855, 1860, 1871); invented improvements in freezing and shipping of meats (1868)
Notes: TR gives birth date as 16 September 1800; Index to BR and DNB give birth year as 1801.
References: "Striving for the Comfort Zone: A Perspective on Julius Jeffreys", Andrew and Judith Marshall, Windy Knoll Publications (2004)
